title: Airspace violation: US scrambles jets to intercept Russian bombers near Alaska
content: NORAD scrambled fighter jets to intercept Russian military aircraft near Alaska, which remained in international airspace and posed no threat. This activity is routine in the Alaskan Air Defense Identification Zone. The announcement follows accusations of Russian airspace violations in Estonia and Poland, with President Trump suggesting NATO countries should shoot down violating planes.

title: B'luru traffic chaos: Wipro rejects CM's request - his 'no silver bullet' reply
content: Karnataka's Chief Minister Siddaramaiah requested Wipro to allow public vehicular access through its Bengaluru campus to alleviate traffic congestion on the Outer Ring Road. Azim Premji declined, citing operational, security, and legal concerns related to the campus's status as a Special Economic Zone. Wipro proposed funding a comprehensive study for long-term solutions.

title: The Rs 30K cr question: Who will get Kapur's empire? Karisma's kids vs stepmom explained
content: The sudden demise of businessman Sunjay Kapur has sparked a high-profile inheritance battle in India, involving his widow, Priya Sachdev Kapur, his mother, Rani Kapur, and his children with Karisma Kapoor. At stake is Kapur's estimated Rs 30,000 crore estate, leading to legal disputes over a contested will and asset distribution.

title: Delhi's 'godman' on the run: Female students tracked via CCTV; fake UN plates
content: Chaitanyananda Saraswati, a self-styled godman, faces accusations of sexually harassing 17 students. He allegedly monitored women via hostel CCTV, even outside bathrooms. Police seized his luxury cars, one with a forged diplomatic plate. Saraswati, now on the run, is suspected to have fled abroad. A lookout circular has been issued, with police teams raiding multiple states.

title: Trump-Erdogan meeting: US prez asks Turkey to stop buying Russian oil
content: During a meeting in the Oval Office, President Trump urged Turkish President Erdogan to halt Russian oil purchases, aiming to pressure Moscow to end the conflict in Ukraine. Trump expressed readiness for major sanctions on Russia if all NATO nations ceased buying Russian oil.

title: Bill Gates credits 15 Indian engineers, says they built Microsoft; viral video
content: Amidst H-1B visa fee hikes and debates, a resurfaced video shows Bill Gates recalling Microsoft's early recruitment of Indian engineers from IITs in the 1980s. Gates emphasizes that this decision was crucial for Microsoft's growth, despite initial criticism about brain drain and concerns over American jobs.

title: Mahesh Bhatt speaks on making 101 film- Exclusive
content: Mahesh Bhatt emphasizes the importance of lived experiences in filmmaking, stating that relevance stems from translating personal narratives into fictional stories. He believes audiences seek solutions to their problems through cinema, connecting with characters who mirror their struggles. Bhatt highlights that low-budget films with authentic stories and relatable themes can resonate deeply, transcending the need for extensive marketing.

title: Will Kenneth Walker III play tonight vs Cardinals? Injury update
content: Kenneth Walker III is set to play a crucial role for the Seattle Seahawks in their NFC West showdown against the Arizona Cardinals. With Walker fully healthy, Seattle plans to heavily utilize him in both rushing and receiving plays.

title: US H-1B $100K fees: Netflix calls it “tax"; founder says it will end lotteries
content: Netflix co-founder Reed Hastings supports Donald Trump's new $100,000 H-1B visa fee, a move that contrasts with the widespread criticism from Silicon Valley leaders. While Hastings believes the fee will ensure H-1B visas are reserved for high-value jobs, the White House clarified it's a one-time payment for new petitions only, causing confusion and concern among tech companies, especially startups.

title: Ladakh protest: MHA cancels FCRA license of Wangchuk's NGO
content: The Ministry of Home Affairs has cancelled the FCRA certificate of Sonam Wangchuk's SECMOL following a CBI inquiry. The ministry cited several violations of the FCRA, including discrepancies in financial transactions, misuse of funds, and acceptance of foreign contributions for activities deemed inappropriate. This action coincides with recent unrest in Ladakh over demands for statehood and constitutional protections.

title: Nighttime symptoms that reveal your heart, liver, and kidney health
content: Recurring nighttime disturbances, such as chest discomfort, itching, or frequent urination, may signal underlying health issues related to the heart, liver, or kidneys. Nighttime is crucial for detecting these problems as bodily functions shift, revealing issues not noticeable during the day. Ignoring persistent symptoms like breathlessness, leg cramps, or swelling can lead to severe complications.

title: Pak 'spy' arrested: Intel leaked during Op Sindoor;'had access to border areas'
content: Rajasthan CID Intelligence arrested Hanif Khan, a Pakistani spy, for leaking confidential Army information to ISI, even during Operation Sindoor. Khan, a resident of Jaisalmer, was in constant contact with Pakistani intelligence via social media. He possessed information about military installations and troop movements, sharing it with a Pakistani handler for money.

title: Will Sam Darnold play tonight vs Cardinals? Injury update
content: Seattle Seahawks will face Arizona Cardinals. All eyes are on quarterback Sam Darnold. He is fit to play. Coach Mike Macdonald praised Darnold's recent performance. Darnold highlighted the team's preparation and execution. The match is scheduled to begin at 8:15 p.m. ET. Fans are eager to witness the game. The team is hoping for a victory.

title: Who is Anze Kopitar’s wife? Family, career & net worth breakdown
content: Anze Kopitar, Los Angeles Kings icon, has a supportive family. He married Ines Domic Kopitar in 2013 and they have two children. Ines runs a business in California. Kopitar's career includes Stanley Cup wins and individual awards. He holds Kings franchise records. His net worth is estimated at $80 million. Kopitar balances hockey with family, charity, and other interests.

title: Andre Agassi & Steffi Graf net worth 2025: Legacy, family & fortune
content: Andre Agassi and Steffi Graf, tennis legends with a combined fortune of $290 million in 2025, continue to impact the sport. Agassi captained Team World to victory at the Laver Cup, while Graf dedicates her time to family and charitable endeavors. Their children, Jaden and Jaz, were seen supporting their father at the Laver Cup, highlighting their enduring family legacy.

title: Asia Cup | 'Inaccurate': Jasprit Bumrah blasts former India cricketer Mohammad Kaif
content: Jasprit Bumrah refuted Mohammad Kaif's remarks regarding his workload management and bowling strategy during the Asia Cup. Kaif had suggested Bumrah's usage under Suryakumar Yadav differed from Rohit Sharma's approach, potentially impacting India's performance. Bumrah dismissed Kaif's assessment as inaccurate, emphasizing his confidence ahead of crucial matches, including the Asia Cup final.

title: Ukrainian woman opens up after getting married to Indian; remembers how her life changd
content: Viktoriia Chakraborty, a Ukrainian woman married to an Indian man, is winning hearts online by embracing Indian culture. After living in India for eight years, she shared her experiences of adopting local customs, including wearing sarees and eating with her hands. Viktoriia's Instagram video showcasing her love for Indian traditions has gone viral, with many praising her integration and happiness.

title: Rajasthan: Farmer's 'aalu se sona' jibe leaves PM Modi in splits - watch
content: During a PM-KUSUM scheme event in Rajasthan's Banswara, a local farmer humorously referenced Rahul Gandhi's 'aaloo se sona' remark, drawing laughter from the audience and even Prime Minister Modi. The farmer praised the solar energy initiative, stating it had brought prosperity to his land, unlike the unfulfilled promise of turning potatoes into gold.

title: 'Missed opportunity': Bumrah's selection slammed; sparks debate
content: Irfan Pathan questions Jasprit Bumrah's inclusion in the Test squad against West Indies. He suggests using the series to test younger fast bowlers. Pathan highlights the importance of managing Bumrah's workload in Indian conditions. He welcomes Axar Patel's return, strengthening India's batting depth. Pathan also raises concerns about who will fill Ravichandran Ashwin's role after his retirement.

title: UNGA: Palestinian prez addresses UN via video after US blocks visa
content: Addressing the UN General Assembly virtually after the US denied his visa, Palestinian President Mahmoud Abbas urged global recognition of Palestine. He asserted that Hamas should relinquish control in Gaza, emphasizing the group's actions on October 7 do not represent the Palestinian people.

title: Election Commission further streamlines process of Counting of Postal Ballots
content: The Election Commission of India will streamline postal ballot counting. This initiative aims to reduce delays and enhance clarity. Counting of postal ballots will take precedence over EVM counting. The second last round of EVM counting will start after postal ballot counting finishes. More tables and staff will be available for postal ballot counting.

title: 'End war or find bomb shelters': Zelenskyy warns Russia
content: President Zelenskyy warned Russian officials to locate bomb shelters, hinting at potential strikes on Moscow if the war persists. He revealed that Donald Trump supported Ukraine striking Russian energy facilities and arms factories. Zelenskyy requested a new weapons system from the U.S.

title: 'Baby, I love you': Shocking details in Delhi 'godman' case; deleted chats under lens
content: A 21-year-old Delhi student has accused Chaitanyananda Saraswati, head of an institute, of persistent sexual harassment. The FIR details inappropriate WhatsApp messages and coercive behavior. Saraswati, already facing multiple charges including fraud and molestation from previous incidents, is currently on the run as police investigate these new allegations, including claims he targeted vulnerable students with promises and threats.

title: Will Cooper Kupp play tonight vs Cardinals? Injury update
content: Cooper Kupp is set to play tonight against the Cardinals, fully recovered from previous injuries. After being released by the Rams in 2025, he joined the Seahawks and has recorded 11 receptions for 136 yards this season. The Seahawks plan to utilize Kupp's experience and precision, making him a key playmaker in their offensive strategy.

title: The reverse migration trend: Why leaving US is becoming new smart move for Indians
content: Many Indian professionals are returning from the US, driven by rising visa costs, burnout, and a desire for family closeness. One Reddit user's story highlights this trend, detailing their move back to India after 11 years in the US. They doubled their wealth by starting a consulting business and enjoying a better work-life balance in a Tier-2 city.

title: Odd flight path: Netanyahu's plane gives Europe wide birth; here's why
content: Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu's flight to the UN General Assembly took a circuitous route, avoiding several European nations possibly due to outstanding arrest warrants issued by the ICC for alleged war crimes. This comes as several European countries have recently recognized Palestinian statehood, a move strongly opposed by Netanyahu.

title: CBSE 2026: Class 12th Arts tentative schedule released; check dates here
content: The Central Board of Secondary Education (CBSE) has released the tentative datesheet for Class 10th and 12th exams on cbse.gov.in. Class 12th Arts exams are expected to begin on February 17, 2025, and conclude by April 9, 2025. Students can start preparing based on this schedule, focusing on conceptual understanding, regular practice, and revision. Practical exams will also be conducted alongside theory papers, and following structured preparation strategies can help students boost performance.

title: Karnataka caste survey: HC declines to interfere; asks to make participation voluntary
content: The Karnataka High Court has allowed the state's caste survey to proceed. The court mandated that participation must be voluntary. Authorities are barred from disclosing participant data. The survey aims to record the socio-economic status of all castes in Karnataka. The survey experienced a slow start due to technical glitches. Enumerators faced issues with the mobile application and network connectivity.

title: Will Marvin Harrison Jr. play against the Seattle Seahawks tonight? Latest injury update
content: Marvin Harrison Jr. will play for the Arizona Cardinals against the Seattle Seahawks. He is fully fit after recovering from minor knee soreness. Coach Gannon plans to use Harrison's versatility. Kyler Murray is expected to target him often. Harrison's performance is crucial for Arizona's offensive strategy. The Cardinals aim to showcase Harrison as a key player in this game.

title: Exclusive | ‘50 was equal to 100 at Oval’: Karun Nair reacts to India snub
content: Karun Nair's hopes for an India Test recall have been dashed as he was excluded from the squad for the West Indies series, despite a strong domestic season. Nair expressed disappointment, highlighting his fifty in the final Test against England. He made it clear that moving forward, he's just going to play in the Ranji Trophy.

title: Ba***ds of B'wood row: Wankhede sues Aryan Khan; alleges damage to reputation
content: Sameer Wankhede has filed a defamation suit in Delhi high court against Shah Rukh Khan's Red Chillies Entertainment, Netflix, and others over Aryan Khan’s directorial debut series, alleging it damages his reputation and undermines anti-drug enforcement agencies. Wankhede seeks damages of Rs 2 crore and a restraint on the show's streaming, claiming it misrepresents events and violates national honor laws.

title: Ba***ds of B'wood row: Who is Sameer Wankhede? All about his link to Aryan Khan
content: Sameer Wankhede, the former NCB director, has filed a lawsuit in Delhi High Court against Aryan Khan's directorial debut, 'The Ba***ds of Bollywood,' and Red Chillies Entertainment. Wankhede alleges the series portrays him falsely and defames anti-drug enforcement agencies. He seeks a permanent injunction, declaration of defamation, damages of Rs 2 crore, and a restraint on the series' streaming.

title: Asia Cup: Gambhir’s 3-word war cry goes viral; India into final
content: India secured their spot in the Asia Cup final with a dominant 41-run victory over Bangladesh, highlighted by Gautam Gambhir's celebratory social media post. Abhishek Sharma's explosive 75 off 37 balls set the stage for India's 168/6, while Kuldeep Yadav's 3/18 restricted Bangladesh to 127. India will now face either Pakistan or Bangladesh in the final.

title: IND-PAK row: PCB, BCCI trade complaints with ICC - what we know so far
content: Tensions surrounding the Asia Cup have escalated as the PCB and BCCI formally engaged the ICC over player conduct. The PCB complained about Suryakumar Yadav's remarks dedicating India's win to victims of the Pahalgam attack, alleging political undertones. The BCCI retaliated, filing a complaint against Pakistan's Haris Rauf and Sahibzada Farhan for provocative gestures.

title: Mega defence deal: Centre inks Rs 62K cr pact for 97 Tejas jets; big boost for IAF
content: The Defence Ministry has signed a significant deal with Hindustan Aeronautics Limited. The agreement involves procuring 97 LCA Mk1A aircraft for the Indian Air Force. This includes 68 fighter jets and 29 twin-seaters. Deliveries are expected to begin in 2027-28. The project emphasizes indigenous content and advanced systems. It will boost self-reliance in defence manufacturing.

title: Wayanad Congress turmoil: DCC chief quits after Priyanka Gandhi Vadra's visit
content: N D Appachan resigned as Wayanad DCC president amid internal conflicts, leaving his fate to the KPCC's decision. This move follows Priyanka Gandhi's constituency visit and a period of factionalism within the Wayanad Congress. The party has also faced controversy due to recent suicides and a suicide attempt linked to local leaders.

title: Ex-French prez gets 5-yr jail term: Convicted for criminal conspiracy; what is Libya case
content: A Paris court found Nicolas Sarkozy guilty of criminal conspiracy. He was acquitted of corruption charges related to alleged illegal funding from Libya. The trial involved claims of Moamer Kadhafi's support for Sarkozy's 2007 campaign. Two aides were convicted, while another was acquitted. The ruling occurred after the death of a key accuser.

title: Ladakh protest: Farooq urges Centre to initiate talks; warns of China threat
content: Farooq Abdullah urged the Centre to engage in dialogue with Ladakh's residents to address their concerns, highlighting China's presence in the region. He dismissed claims of external instigation behind recent protests, attributing them to unmet promises of statehood and the Sixth Schedule.

title: NHL: Lauren Kyle, Celeste Desjardins step out for girl date night
content: Lauren Kyle, wife of Connor McDavid, enjoyed a girls' night out with Celeste Desjardins at her restaurant, Bar Trove, showcasing her fall fashion. Beyond nightlife, Kyle hosted a charity poker tournament supporting the Oilers Foundation's initiative to help children access youth sports. She balances style, social influence, and philanthropy, establishing herself as a prominent figure in Edmonton.

title: 'Rampur, Mudhol': BSF turns to Indian dog breeds - what inspired shift?
content: Inspired by PM Modi's 'Mann Ki Baat', the BSF is training and deploying Indian dog breeds like Rampur Hound and Mudhol Hound along India's borders. Around 150 Indian breed dogs have been trained and deployed, adding to the 700 dogs already serving. Riya, a BSF-bred Indian dog, won the Best Tracker Dog award in 2024, showcasing their capabilities.

title: Bryson, Rory eye Bethpage matchup amid rivalry
content: Bryson DeChambeau and Rory McIlroy said being matched up against each other this week at the Ryder Cup would be welcomed.

title: Liberty GM: Call on champ Brondello 'proactive'
content: Liberty general manager Jonathan Kolb says the decision not to bring back coach Sandy Brondello was not solely based on this season's results and that a coaching change was "very much under consideration last season," when New York won the WNBA title.

title: Report: UEFA expected to vote to suspend Israel
content: European soccer body UEFA is moving toward a vote to suspend its member federation Israel over the war in Gaza, people familiar with the proposal told The Associated Press on Thursday.

title: Jets' Fields returns to practice, to start if cleared
content: Jets quarterback Justin Fields remains in the concussion protocol but is progressing toward a possible return for the game Monday night at the Dolphins.

title: Panthers' Barkov helped off ice after injuring leg
content: Panthers captain Aleksander Barkov needed to be helped off the ice after appearing to sustain an injury to his right leg during the first full training camp practice of the season.

title: Stars' Benn (collapsed lung) out at least 4 weeks
content: Stars captain and left winger Jamie Benn will miss at least four weeks after having surgery on a collapsed lung, the team announced Thursday.

title: Hawk skateboard from famed 900 draws $1.15M
content: The skateboard Tony Hawk used to land an unprecedented 900 in competition has sold for around $1.152 million at auction, about double the presale estimate.

title: Guardians overtake Tigers with historic surge
content: The Guardians became the first MLB team to overcome a deficit of 15½ games and take the lead in either division or league play after beating the Tigers to take a one-game edge in the AL Central.

title: Raleigh joins the 60 home run club! A monthly breakdown of the historic campaign
content: The Mariners slugger just joined an elite club with his 60th homer. Here's a look back at the road that got him here.

title: Six NFL teams are 0-3: What's the problem, and what to expect
content: The Giants are going with Jaxson Dart at QB as history shows the difference between 1-3 and 0-4 is drastic for playoff hopes.

title: Week 4 buzz: What we're hearing on Dart, Penix and trade deadline talk
content: Here's the latest intel on the Giants starting Jaxson Dart, and Michael Penix Jr.'s struggles in Atlanta.

title: 'Our tradition to is to be untraditional': Inside the lifecycle of an Oregon uniform
content: Throughout the past two and a half decades, Oregon has pushed the envelope when it comes to uniforms.

title: Week 5 preview: Georgia-Alabama, key conference matchups, plus quarterbacks to know
content: Big conference matchups, quarterbacks that are making a name for themselves and more ahead of Week 5.

title: Which major NFL trades look better -- or worse -- in hindsight? Barnwell's fresh takes on 23 recent swaps
content: In March 2022, Seattle traded away Russell Wilson, altering the franchise's path. Let's reevaluate that move, plus 22 others from 2022-23.

title: The Playbook: Lineup locks, Shadow Reports for Week 4
content: An all-encompassing look at the matchups to exploit or avoid and lineup locks in fantasy, as well as projected scores for all NFL games.

title: The Seahawks underwent an offensive makeover in one offseason -- is it working?
content: The Seahawks have a new QB in Sam Darnold, new receivers and a new scheme, thanks to coordinator Klint Kubiak.

title: Cardinals QB Kyler Murray makes key adjustment in his seventh season
content: Murray has learned to take what's available instead of forcing long throws, and it's making a difference.

title: How a historic trade in February has helped shape the WNBA semifinals
content: The biggest trade in WNBA history happened last February. Now a player involved in that deal will win a WNBA title.

title: WNBA playoff schedule: Fever, Lynx take 1-0 leads in semifinals
content: The 2025 WNBA semifinals are underway, and Phoenix beat Minnesota in OT in an instant classic Tuesday.

title: Stanley Cup contender rankings: Who dethrones the Panthers, Oilers?
content: It's been the same Cup Final matchup in consecutive years. Here are the teams that can change that in 2025-26.

title: Ovi breaks another Gretzky record? Bold predictions for every NHL team
content: With opening night approaching on Oct. 7, we take big swings on what will transpire for each team this season.

title: Why clubs shouldn't freeze players out, like Chelsea are doing with Raheem Sterling
content: The trend of players having to train away from the first team -- like Chelsea's Raheem Sterling and Axel Disasi -- is a reminder that clubs hold an unfair amount of leverage.

title: Will Tessmann leapfrog McKennie, Musah to start for USMNT at 2026 World Cup?
content: Tanner Tessmann hasn't represented the U.S. since March, but he has been so good at Lyon in 2025-26 that Mauricio Pochettino can't keep ignoring him.

title: What it's like for former Cowboys stars -- such as Micah, Emmitt, DeMarcus, Zeke -- to return to Dallas as an opponent
content: Micah Parsons will follow in the footsteps of Emmitt Smith, DeMarcus Ware and Ezekiel Elliott on Sunday as an opponent at AT&T Stadium.

title: Lost seasons, disastrous drafts and fans rooting for the visiting team: Inside the Rockies' road to rock bottom
content: As Colorado nears the finish of one of the worst seasons in MLB history. Here's why the decline was a long time coming.

title: For A's fans, new city, same anger
content: A year after the move to West Sacramento, franchise still grapples with low attendance and outrage at owner.

title: Expert picks, best bets: Can Reyes halt Ulberg's winning streak at UFC Fight Night?
content: Who has the edge at UFC Fight Night from Perth, Australia? MMA analysts and a betting insider make their picks.

title: College football best bets for Week 5: Why UK matches up well with South Carolina
content: Pamela Maldonado breaks down her favorite bets for Week 5 of the college football season, including what to expect when Kentucky heads to South Carolina.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Arsenal, Liverpool, Man United track Semenyo
content: Premier League clubs are lining up to battle for AFC Bournemouth forward Antoine Semenyo. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Early men's Bracketology: Houston stays No. 1, Virginia gives ACC hope
content: The new Cavaliers coach is tasked with winning as big as the coach he once beat in a historic upset. Can it be done in Year 1?

title: What Bruce Pearl's retirement means for Auburn, college basketball
content: The Tigers' winningest coach is retiring. Here's what that means with 42 days until the 2025-26 season.

title: Philadelphia 76ers unveil Iverson-era throwback uniforms
content: The uniform unveiling celebrates the 25th anniversary of the 76ers' Eastern Conference championship-winning team.

title: Trees are back: Timberwolves unveil KG-era throwback uniforms
content: From 1998 to 2008, Minnesota wore this look, making eight straight playoff appearances and a West finals run.

title: Category league mock draft: Jokic or Wemby at No. 1?
content: Our 10-team, H2H category league mock draft included familiar faces a the top and Amen Thompson, Cade Cunningham and Tyrese Maxey all going in the top 25.

title: Draft guide: All you need to win your league this season
content: We've got everything you need to help you prepare for and execute a successful draft, all in one place.

title: Battle for No. 1: Draisaitl, Pastrnak and the players to consider
content: Six players have a chance at being the No. 1 pick in fantasy hockey drafts, and we look at each one is deserving.

title: Sonam Wangchuk To NDTV On Possible Arrest And Key Allegations
content: Ladakh statehood activist Sonam Wangchuk and the central government are on a warpath following the violent protests in the mountainous region that left four killed and over 50 injured.

title: Telangana Government To Acquire L&T's Hyderabad Metro Stake
content: The Telangana government and Larsen and Toubro group have reached an in-principle agreement for the state to acquire L&T's stake in the Hyderabad Metro Rail project.

title: In A First, Polish Man Skis Down Mount Everest Without Oxygen Tank
content: Poland's Andrzej Bargiel has become the first person to ski down Mount Everest without an oxygen tank, his team said on Thursday.

title: Israel Strikes Yemen's Rebel-Held Capital Sanaa
content: Israel launched air strikes on Yemen's rebel-held capital Sanaa on Thursday, Huthi media and Israeli officials said, a day after a drone attack wounded nearly two dozen people at an Israeli resort.

title: Netanyahu's Plane Takes Unusual Route Over Airspaces To Avoid Arrest
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu avoided most of Europe's skies on his way to New York, seemingly steering clear of countries where he could face arrest over alleged war crimes.

title: "Our Education Schemes Not For Votes": Tamil Nadu Industries Minister
content: Tamil Nadu Industries Minister TRB Rajaa on Thursday dismissed speculation that the ruling DMK's student outreach programmes are aimed at countering actor-politician Vijay's growing influence among the youth.

title: In Madhya Pradesh, A Daughter Deity Who Loves Slippers And Smiles
content: Amid the ongoing Navratri festival, the celebrations in a temple situated high on a hill in Bhopal are not for a Goddess as a fierce protector or a benevolent mother, but as a daughter.

title: BMW Crash: Injured Taken To Nursing Home, Not Hospital, Says Prosecution
content: The prosecution on Thursday argued that the injured in the BMW accident case were taken to a nursing home instead of a hospital, and that the car was overspeeding.

title: 60 Detained After Social Media Post Sparks Violence In Gujarat Village: Cops
content: A group of minority community members damaged several shops and vehicles and hurled stones at a village in Gandhinagar district following an objectionable social media post, police said on Thursday.

title: Turkish President To Meet Trump At White House, Seek Deal On F-35 Fighter Jets
content: Trump will host Turkish President Tayyip Erdogan at the White House, where the Turkish leader hopes to leverage the countries' warmest bilateral ties in years to convince Washington to drop US sanctions and allow it to purchase F-35 fighter jets

title: China Unveils New Climate Goals, Plans 7-10% Emissions Cut by 2035
content: China has for the first time made specific emission cut pledges, though its goal of reducing planet-warming greenhouse gases just seven to 10 percent by 2035 is seen as far too modest.

title: Vandalism Of Indira Gandhi, Rajiv Gandhi's Statues In Bengal Sparks Row
content: Political tension escalated in West Bengal's Asansol after the statues of former prime ministers Indira Gandhi and Rajiv Gandhi were allegedly vandalised.

title: 'Woman In Pink': Victim In Spanish Cold Case Identified After 20 Years
content: A woman nicknamed "The Woman in Pink" after her body was found in Spain two decades ago has finally been identified, Interpol said Thursday.

title: Protesters Surround House Of Zubeen Garg's Manager In Assam, Seek Answers
content: A large number of protesters surrounded the house of the manager of renowned singer Zubeen Garg in Assam's Guwahati today. The iconic singer's death in Singapore has devastated fans and well-wishers.

title: Jharkhand Man Sentenced To Death For Killing 5 Members Of Family Over Property Dispute
content: A man was sentenced to death by a court in Jharkhand's Seraikela-Kharswan district on Thursday for killing five members of his family, including three children, over a land dispute.

title: Highway Chaos In Bengal As Truck Driver, Civic Volunteer Thrash Each Other
content: A civic volunteer allegedly assaulted a truck driver along the National Highway 19 in West Bengal, only to be beaten up with slippers in full public view.

title: 40 Minor Girls Found Locked Inside Toilet Of Illegal Madrassa In UP: Cops
content: Forty girls aged between nine and 14 years were found confined inside a toilet of an unregistered madrassa here during an inspection, officials said on Thursday.

title: Blog: Blog | The Story Of Abhijot, A Child Who Fought For His Life In A Flooded Punjab Village
content: Punjab experienced the worst floods this year since 1988. As many as 14 areas had villages that were completely inundated. Among those areas was Amritsars Ajnala, where in a village called Talwindi Rai Dadu, Abhijot resided with his family.

title: Central Agency Raids Jindal Group Firms Over Suspected FEMA Violations
content: The Enforcement Directorate has carried out search operations under the Foreign Exchange Management Act at 13 locations linked to the BC Jindal Group and its associates. The searches were conducted last week across Delhi-NCR and Hyderabad

title: UP Boy Hides To Skip Tuition, Found Asleep At Home After 4-Hour Hunt By Cops
content: A frantic four-hour search for a missing Class 4 boy in Gorakhpur ended dramatically when police, aided by a sniffer dog, found him fast asleep inside his house in a corner where he hid to avoid tuition.

title: Zubeen Garg death: SIT raid at manager's house; protesters clash with cops
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics .

title: Delhi court lifts gag order that banned journalist Paranjoy Guha Thakurta from reporting on Adani Enterprises
content: Trial court asked to pass a fresh order in the matter after hearing the applicants on Friday, September 26; Mr. Thakurta not required to follow the gag order till fresh orders passed

title: Ladakh protesters died of bullet wounds: Ladakh Buddhist Association
content: The four deaths indicate ‘indiscriminate firing by the police’ during protests in Leh, says Buddhist body; 15 persons suffered serious injuries, says DGP; MHA-Ladakh group meeting likely on Sept. 27-28

title: KKRTC to operate 500 extra buses to clear Dasara rush
content: These extra services will run from district, taluk centres in Kalyana Karnataka to Bengaluru and Tuljapur in Solapur district of Maharashtra

title: Madras High Court judges to inspect Tiruvannamalai Arunachaleswarar Temple
content: Justices R. Suresh Kumar and S. Sounthar take the decision due to complaints regarding certain constructions being put up inside the temple premises

title: Corrupt Ministers will not be spared, says Palaniswami
content: DMK men have been threatening quarry owners and demanding ₹100 for every tonne of m-sand, p-sand and blue mined across Tamil Nadu, says the AIADMK leader

title: Kudumbashree to expand FNHW activities
content: Goal is to develop culture of health and sports education among people; activities to be implemented in coordination with other departments

title: Amid shortage of fertilizers in Uttar Pradesh, Opposition alleges farmers stressed over government inaction
content: In viral videos shared online, farmers could be seen standing in long queues for hours and failing to receive the fertilizers and seeds due to apparent shortage

title: CPI(M) leader’s comments on Mamkootathil’s “partner in crime” create row
content: Shafi Parambil, MP, condemns CPI(M) Palakkad district secretary E.N. Suresh Babu’s “libellous slander.” Leader of the Opposition V.D. Satheesan says the MP will sue Babu for the slight

title: Air India crash: Captain’s grieving father says investigators insinuated son cut fuel to flight’s engines
content: Initial probe said one pilot asked another why he cut the fuel; Captain's father accuses Indian investigators of 'procedurally improper' remarks; pilots' union condemns investigators' visit to father in Mumbai

title: Government revokes FCRA licence of Wangchuk’s organisation
content: A day after Leh unrest, for which the government blamed Sonam Wangchuk’s “provocative statements”, the Home Ministry cancels FCRA nod to SEMCOL; the alleged violations include accepting foreign funds to study “national sovereignty” and poor recordkeeping

title: HC asks lawyer why he failed to notice disclaimer on smoking on the back cover of Arundhati Roy’s book Mother Mary Comes To Me
content: The petitioner lawyer Rajasimhan had filed a PIL seeking a stay on the sale of the book whose cover photo shows her smoking a ‘bidi’

title: ECI tweaks postal vote counting process
content: Till now, counting of postal ballots would begin from 8 a.m. and the EVM rounds at 8.30 a.m; the poll body has decided that the penultimate round of EVM counting will start only after all the postal ballots are accounted for

title: Focus on State highways, tourism corridors and inter-State routes to fill gaps in Kerala’s EV charging network, says new report
content: Cities like Kochi, Thiruvananthapuram and Kozhikode exhibit strong coverage, while rural belts lag behind, cites a report by KSEB’s EV Accelerator Cell

title: Students continue to protest over paper leak in Uttarakhand, demand CBI inquiry
content: Protesting students allege that the BJP government’s anti-cheating law, that came into force in 2023, is no deterrent for the cheating mafia

title: 'Surgical strike': Aaditya hints at Rahul-style presser on Maha voter fraud
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports .

title: Transported in handcuffs: US deports Sikh grandma; not allowed to meet kin
content: seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sift through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock . we strive to keep you informed about the ever-evolving world, providing a nuanced understanding of international affairs to our readers .

title: Link to wages? US mulls shift in H-1B visa lottery system; bad odds for entry-level workers
content: the Indian diaspora is the largest in the world; through her articles she demystifies the immigration-policy related developments in select countries . she also analyses the impact of Income-tax and GST related developments for individuals and business entities .

title: News: Rangers shut down third player this week; Padres lose Laureano
content: fantasy baseball buzz file aims to provide fantasy managers with the intel they need as news breaks around MLB . only 24 of the 30 teams in action today, with only 24 in action . the first game begins at 12:40 p.m. ET with the Pittsburgh Pirates going for the road sweep over the Cincinnati Reds .

title: BRS govt. spent a fraction of capital expenditure on education and health sectors, says CAG report
content: CAG report says only ₹2,550 crore out of Capex of ₹2.55 lakh crore spent on education related activities

title: e-waste collection drive to be expanded to Kerala’s panchayats too
content: The collection drive, by Haritha Karma Sena volunteers, began on pilot basis in December 2024 in a few municipalities and panchayats. Later in July this year, it was expanded to all Corporations

title: Communal clashes in Gandhinagar over WhatsApp status, 60 detained
content: The conflict erupted over a WhatsApp status message referencing an ongoing social media trend on the declarations “I love Muhammad” or “I love Mahadev”

title: Karnataka High Court declines to stop caste survey, but imposes conditions for conducting it
content: Court says people have to be informed that participation in survey is not mandatory and they should not be persuaded to answer queries

title: Watch: PM Modi flags off three Vande Bharat trains, unveils ₹1 lakh crore projects in Rajasthan
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated projects worth over ₹1 lakh crore in Banswara, Rajasthan, including the 2,800 MW Mahi-Banswara nuclear power project. He also flagged off three new Vande Bharat Express trains, underscoring the government’s push for clean energy and modern infrastructure.

title: Telangana to take over Hyderabad Metro Phase 1 from L&T in ₹15,000-crore deal
content: The development follows discussions between Telangana Chief Minister A. Revanth Reddy and L&T Chairman & Managing Director S.N. Subrahmanyan, along with other senior officials, to resolve issues and pave the way for the second phase of the metro project

title: Govt. medical college teachers in Kerala to intensify stir
content: KGMCTA accuses the State government of ignoring their grievances related to the release of salary and dearness allowance arrears, anomalies in the pay structure of the entry-level cadre, and the creation of new posts in newly sanctioned GMCs

title: Compensation for sinking of MSC Elsa 3: HC reduces security amount to ₹1,227.62 cr.
content: This is a modification of its order of July 7 in an admiralty suit filed by the State government, following which its sister vessel MSC Akiteta-2 had been detained at Vizhinjam. The government had claimed ₹9,531 crore as compensation, mainly for the marine and coastal pollution and the loss caused to fishers

title: Shipwreck case likely to be long-drawn battle, although MSC instructed to pay security of ₹1,227.62 crore
content: The shipping major has neither deposited ₹9,531 crore as sought by Kerala in the admiralty suit nor furnished security for the same

title: Allot land, provide jobs and schools to bring back tribals that fled due to Maoist violence: NCST to Chhattisgarh
content: Urges Union Ministries of Home Affairs and Tribal Affairs to come up with a dedicated policy for tribal families displaced from Chhattisgarh due to left-wing extremist violence

title: MoHUA approves ₹50 crore grant for setting up Municipal Shared Service Centres in Andhra Pradesh
content: The initiative aims to transform service delivery across 123 Urban Local Bodies by pooling resources, leveraging technology, and enhancing financial sustainability

title: Naidu hands over appointment orders to 15,941 newly recruited teachers, promises annual DSC notifications
content: Teaching is not just a profession, it is a responsibility to educate and empower the students who are our future, says Chief Minister

title: D. Raja re-elected as CPI national general secretary
content: The party also announced the new national secretariat including — Amarjeet Kaur, B.C. Kango, Prakash Babu, Pallab Veckat Reddy, Girish Sharma, and Ram Kishan Panda among others, forming an 11-member national secretariat and a 31-member Executive Committee

title: Delhi HC to pass interim order on Nagarjuna’s plea to protect personality rights
content: Nagarjuna’s counsel submitted that he was aggrieved by three infringements— pornographic websites, the unauthorised sale of merchandise using the actor’s personality traits and various YouTube videos

title: Electrical equipment being procured only through e-Procurement portal and competitive bidding, says A.P. Energy Minister Ravi Kumar
content: Purchases above ₹5 crore being made with prior approval of the A.P. Electricity Regulatory Commission, he says

title: Ladakh remains tense amid curfew, four bodies handed over to families for final rites
content: The hunger strike was being held to press the Centre to prepone Ladakh-Delhi dialogue over the demands of Statehood and inclusion in the Sixth Schedule

title: Huge protest by job aspirants throws life out of gear in Dharwad
content: Protesting under the aegis of All Karnataka State Students Association, they are demanding that the State govt. take steps to fill vacancies

title: Thrissur leads the way in sustainable waste management
content: Kerala State Pollution Control Board awards first place to Corporation General Hospital’s 360 KLD STP

title: Tirumala Brahmotsavams: Lord Malayappa, dressed as Lord Krishna, rides ‘Chinna Sesha vahanam’
content: The deity, seated atop the golden chariot with a cup of cheese in one hand and a golden flute on the other, is the cynosure of all eyes

title: Govt. unveils 90-day plan to fix Bengaluru’s crumbling infrastructure
content: The plan also introduces the possibility of congestion pricing on the Outer Ring Road (ORR), one of the city’s busiest and most gridlocked corridors

title: Analysis | Why Ladakh’s statehood protest in Leh turned deadly
content: Violence in Leh has left several dead and many injured as Ladakh’s demand for statehood and Sixth Schedule status spiralled into clashes. Police firing injured over 30 personnel after protests turned violent, following activist Sonam Wangchuk’s hunger strike. The Centre has blamed provocative remarks, while locals accuse Delhi of delaying talks. With curfew imposed, anchor Vijaita Singh, Deputy Editor, is joined by Political Activist Sajjad Kargili to unpack what triggered the flashpoint, the politics behind the unrest, and its implications for the border region.

title: Stuck guide wire after surgery: Medical Board says attempts to retrieve guide wire can potentially cause more harm to the patient
content: 24-year-old woman had undergone thyroid removal surgery in March 2023 at General Hospital in Thiruvananthapuram

title: ₹2.45 crore sanctioned for Vilangan Kunnu makeover
content: The project, which aims at creating and renovating amenities at the lush green hillock, is likely to be completed in 12 months

title: Geo-tagging proves to be a boon for pilgrims thronging Tirumala for Brahmotsavams
content: The Tirupati district police have introduced the digital initiative that is aimed at reuniting missing persons with their families with ease

title: Cong. scrambles to read political tea leaves of NSS’ implicit trust in govt.’s Sabarimala policy
content: It also seems to worry BJP, particularly, that  SNDP Yogam, whose political arm BDJS is an NDA ally, has found itself in agreement with  NSS regarding support for LDF’s Sabarimala policy. BJP leader V. Muraleedharan says party had borne the brunt of the 2018 agitation

title: NFL betting buzz: Colts flying up odds boards amid hot start
content: the news cycle will constantly and significantly affect the sports betting industry . our betting buzz file aims to provide fans a look at sports betting stories that are driving the conversation . the public has continuously voiced its support for the road team .

title: ⚾ MLB playoff tracker, clinch scenarios
content: a number of teams are starting to shift their focus to October as the final month of the 2025 MLB regular season continues . the Milwaukee Brewers and Chicago Cubs have both clinched postseason berths, with the los Angeles Dodgers also taking home the NL Central title .

title: Top storylines to watch at the 2025 Ryder Cup
content: team USA captain Keegan Bradley and team Europe captain Luke Donald are both eager and ready for the 2025 Ryder Cup to begin Friday . the first match of the day will go off at 7:10 a.m. the parings for the first four matches will be announced Thursday afternoon .

title: College football September transfer surprises
content: the best players available in college football's transfer portal are making millions . talent evaluation is still the name of the game during the portal season . this is not exactly an early all-transfer team; we'll get to that later in the season.

title: Not who we thought they were: Five nice surprises and three early-season letdowns
content: the season has kicked off but there's still time to start fresh with a 0-0 record . there are also players who didn't find their way onto the fantasy radar in July and August . they are the ones producing weekly numbers and working their way into fantasy lineups .

title: Early-season angst check: Do Madrid, Man United, Wrexham need to be worried?
content: the offseason is for either angst or excitement, and for the nine entities below -- eight clubs and one league -- there was more of the latter than latter . let's check in on whether the angster is growing or dissipating for the motley crew of Real Madrid , Manchester City , the Bundesliga , Wrexham , Newcas .

title: MLB insiders predict the playoffs: Bold takes, dangerous teams and breakout stars
content: our baseball insiders are ready to break down the biggest questions, latest news and notable buzz across the industry . what is the boldest prediction we've heard from an MLB exec? will the Toronto Blue Jays and Milwaukee Brewers turn stellar regular seasons into deep playoff runs?

title: Coaches outmaneuver NFL's defenses with court ruling on arbitration
content: two separate courts have ruled in favor of coaches' challenges to arbitration requirements . one panel labeled the league's arbitration process "unconscionable" and another called it "unworthy even of the name of arbitration" a spokesman did not provide comment, but legal analysts say the court decisions are likely to have a wider impact on the power dynamic between the league and its employees .

title: Yatra politics in Bihar: Why Tejashwi may be reluctant to join hands with Owaisi
content: Jamdani to Banarasi: New brides, celebrate your first Durga Puja in these Bengal fabrics Out of the ordinary: Three letter unique baby names 9 books to sharpen your mind and analytical skills Kalyani Priyadarshan in scarlet symphony Survival of the fittest: 8 animals with the most bizarre defense mechanisms! title: Ranking the 10 best players in the NBA for this season
content: the "NBA Today" crew discusses a preseason poll naming Nikola Jokic the best player in the NBA . our 2025 NBA Rank wraps up as we break down the final top 10 players in the league . we asked our expert panel to vote on player vs. player matchups .
